image.altText: A group of masked men stand amongst more men dressed in army uniforms

props.synopsis: WA Police allege a 42-year-old Perth man organised people to kill his father-in-law in India, in a violent attack which left the man with serious brain injuries.

title.children: Perth man allegedly hired hit men in India in attempt to kill father-in-law

image.altText: wind farm hero option b

props.synopsis: Developers say the proposed 100 turbine farm to be built near Collie, outside the town of Moodiarrup, will produce enough electricity to power the Perth CBD.

title.children: Plans for Western Australia's largest wind farm revealed

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders Bruce Lehrmann to pay $2 million to Network Ten over his failed defamation case.

title.children: Federal Court orders Bruce Lehrmann to pay $2 million to Network Ten over failed defamation case

image.altText: A strangely shaped bridge across a river.

props.synopsis: Property prices in Perth have reached record highs in recent months and are expected to rise even further in the coming year, with a prediction they will increase between 8 and 11 per cent.

title.children: Perth property prices tipped to soar, as cost of materials puts brakes on new builds

image.altText: An advertisment for gummy mushrooms

props.synopsis: An urgent recall is issued for Uncle Frog mushroom gummies after consumers around the country are hospitalised with serious health symptoms including hallucinations and seizures.

title.children: Memory loss and 'impending doom': Mother hospitalised after eating mushroom gummies, nationwide recall issued

image.altText: A woman holds up a hand-painted sign saying Stop giving details.

props.synopsis: Financial counsellors and community leaders warn residents in remote communities in Western Australia to remain vigilant of a rise in scams ahead of tax time.

title.children: Spike in scams targeting remote communities ahead of tax time

image.altText: The six politicians stand in front of the US Capitol building.

props.synopsis: A cross-party delegation of jet-lagged and obstinate Australian parliamentarians arrived in Washington DC last September to advocate for Julian Assange's freedom. Those in the room reflect on how the "robust", and at times "aggressive", meeting went.

title.children: 'There was an attempt to brush us away': How six Australian MPs took the cause of Julian Assange to Washington

image.altText: Police on suburban street with blue and white tape cordoning off the area.

props.synopsis: Officers were called to a home in Russell Lea just after 11am when member of the public reported hearing a woman scream for help.

title.children: Housemate arrested after woman fatally stabbed in Sydney home

image.altText: Scam victim Lee Braz on motorbike.

props.synopsis: Lee fought the financial ombudsman all the way to the federal court when scammers stole his super. Despite winning he only got some money back and after legal fees he's worse off.

title.children: 'Worked 40 years for nothing': Scammers tricked Lee's super fund and stole 180k

image.altText: A graphic showing two glasses of red wine being touched above the NDIA logo.

props.synopsis: A parliamentary probe calls for a broader investigation into how private firms interact with government departments, after it was revealed NDIA officials were showered with gifts from a US tech firm it had a contract with, and which they did not declare.

title.children: Salesforce wined and dined NDIA officials, now a committee has asked if other agencies are receiving gifts

image.altText: Two men and a water pipe from the ground.

props.synopsis: More than 5,000 people across Dunsborough have had their water cut off this morning, with emergency repairs now underway.

title.children: Emergency repairs underway as water supply cut off for thousands in South West WA

image.altText: A man in glasses wearing a tie.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has been put on the spot about inflation as Question Time heats up. Follow live.

title.children: PM under pressure over inflation as Question Time heats up

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: No mention of Assange during QT
Dutton says its harder for the Coalition to get women in its ranks
Defence refers $1 billion contract to corruption watchdog

image.altText: A group of players celebrate an Origin try

props.synopsis: Only two New South Wales sides have won deciders on Queensland soil but after their thumping win in Melbourne, this year's Blues are certain they can climb Origin's highest mountain.

title.children: 'What a story it's going to be': Why Blues believe they can pull off State of Origin's mission impossible

image.altText: Michael Sukkar wears a suit with a red tie.

props.synopsis: Shadow Minister for Housing Michael Sukkar says the number overseas arrivals since Labor came to power is four times greater than the number of houses built. RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Fact check: Are overseas arrivals outpacing housing construction at a rate of four to one?

image.altText: Max Chandler-Mather and Andrew Bragg

props.synopsis: A Labor plan to entice foreign investors to build apartments for renters has run into a roadblock in the Senate today, with the Greens and Coalition set to team up to single out a housing plan.

title.children: Greens, Liberals to team up to delay another Labor housing policy

image.altText: A mugshot of a man in a composite image with a court house.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy who performed first aid on his mum and CPR on her new boyfriend, who had both been stabbed by the boy's father, has been praised by a judge for "undoubtedly" saving his mother's life.

title.children: 'Family violence of the most extreme kind': Man sentenced for stabbing ex-partner, new boyfriend in front of children

image.altText: Daniel Victor Gandini, wearing a three piece suit and peak cap, standing in the sunshine on the street in Burnie.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man found guilty of two counts of assault and of splashing a corrosive acid on arresting police officers in 2021 has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: 'Diplomat Dan' sentenced to more than three years' jail over assault of wife, splashing acid on police

image.altText: A spacecraft is blasting off from a launchpad with loads of smoke underneath

props.synopsis: It's now three weeks in space and counting for Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, as NASA and Boeing troubleshoot problems with their space capsule. Three potential landing dates have so far been called off, and their flight home is now on hold.

title.children: Two astronauts are waiting on the International Space Station. Here's why NASA can't say when they're going home

image.altText: a young man in a white robe leads a procession of priests through a Catholic church

props.synopsis: A Melbourne church is defying the Pope with a centuries-old service in a dead language. Why are so many young Catholics travelling hours to get there?

title.children: 'Zoomers want authenticity': These young Catholics are choosing a dead language over a modernising Pope

image.altText: A poster with French writing on it and the pictures of a woman and a man smiling.

props.synopsis: A far-right wave is sweeping through France and while it is polarising the country, there is something many can agree on: a desire to see President Emmanuel Macron's party booted out of office.

title.children: 'We are in a country that is going to sink': Inside the far-right wave sweeping France

image.altText: Marilyn Monroe lays on her stomach on a lawn, smiling into the distance as she rests her chin on her right hand

props.synopsis: Marilyn Monroe's home will not be demolished after the LA City Council deems the property a historical landmark, thwarting the plans of neighbours to expand their estate.

title.children: Home where Marilyn Monroe lived and died avoids demolition after being deemed a historical landmark

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: AI-generated videos of Elon Musk asking people to invest in cryptocurrency were uploaded to the Channel Seven YouTube channel after it appeared to be hacked.

title.children: Channel Seven investigating after YouTube page replaced with AI-generated Elon Musk videos

image.altText: Julian and Stella embrace at Canberra Airport.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange has spent his first night home in Australia, after a legal saga that has lasted more than a decade. Assange's team says he is now a free man, and his wife says their reunion was a moment only an image can describe.

title.children: Julian Assange wakes as a free man, home in Australia with his family

image.altText: A close-up photo of Julian Assange's face as he walks into court in a suit.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange has been convicted under the US Espionage Act, with his guilty plea enabling him to come home to Australia. Here's a recap of the situation to get you up to speed.

title.children: Who is Julian Assange and what exactly did he do?

image.altText: A composite image of Donald Trump and Joe Biden standing at microphones at podiums and gesturing with their hands.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden and Donald Trump are preparing to share a stage for the first time in four years — and some longstanding traditions have been upended for the first debate of the 2024 election race.

title.children: No notes, no props and microphones that can be muted: What to know ahead of tomorrow's debate

image.altText: a man with short black hair and glasses wears a black suit jacket and leans on a new kitchen island table

props.synopsis: After a downturn during the pandemic, foreign buyers are back. Most are coming from China, Hong Kong and India, with the value of transactions hitting almost $5 billion over the past financial year.

title.children: Cashed-up foreign buyers are buying more Australian property, but it's just a fraction of the market

image.altText: Scaffolding with a sign saying "Go Tigers" over fencing.

props.synopsis: Albany football club Railways say it's even willing to let its rivals choose the name if they win an upcoming raffle to raise money for a major redevelopment at its home ground.

title.children: Country footy club to let raffle winner pick stadium name — no matter how ridiculous

image.altText: A graphic showing silhouettes of four teenagers standing on either side of a nuclear power plant with steam rising from it.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has pledged to build nuclear power plants in these teenagers' regions if the Coalition wins the next election. Some are excited by the prospect of a new industry but others want to keep the focus on renewables.

title.children: The Coalition needs votes from young people, so are they on board with its nuclear plan?

image.altText: Dozens of hens with glossy brown feathers and red plump combs under a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: The ACT government says the case was detected at a Canberra farm and that the property has been quarantined.

title.children: Bird flu case detected at Canberra farm, but government says risk to community low

image.altText: Paris Hilton with long blonde hair, serious expression on her face, tilting head to one side, wearing a pale blue suit jacket

props.synopsis: Hotel heiress Paris Hilton has called for greater oversight of youth care programs while sharing her experiences with a US House of Representatives committee hearing on strengthening child welfare.

title.children: Paris Hilton tells US Congress she was 'force-fed' medications, sexually abused in youth treatment facilities

image.altText: Wide view of cottages in the foreground with a new timber extension at the far side. A bridge over a river is visible

props.synopsis: This 140-year-old police barracks had no running water, electricity or doors, but it wasn't enough to put Kim and Alan off transforming it into their family home.

title.children: A couple spent weekends transforming this old police barracks into their family home. Here's how they did it

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Lots to get to today, with labour force information and some interesting jobs data also due out. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slumps after release of hot inflation data sparking fears of another rate hike

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sydney remains the most visited capital city for international tourists
Job vacancies drop further in May

image.altText: A large portrait of the artist painted on the side of an appartment building. It pictures the artist gazing out at the viewer

props.synopsis: It was one of Australian artist Jasmine Crisp's "biggest ever life dreams" to paint an original international mural — and she had only one week to do it.

title.children: A trolley of paint and 12-hour days: Aussie artist pulls off three-storey mural in Italy in a week
